Ebbro 43671 Nissan Skyline GTS-R (R31) 1988 JTCC Series Div. 1 2nd Place A. Olofsson/A. Suzuki

Purchased: 2014
Manufacturer page: http://ebbro.co.jp/item_race/nissan/43671.html

The Japanese Touring Car Championship (JTCC) began in 1985 and was Japan's Group A championship series. Instead of sprint races (common in Europe) it was a long-distance championship with races over 300 or 500 km. Apart from imported cars like BMW or Ford, there were many Japanese cars taking part - and with great results, especially at the end of Group A in the early 1990s.

Anders Olofsson and Aguri Suzuki drove this Skyline GTS-R in the 1988 JTCC series. The first victory for the 6-cylinder Skyline and for Olofsson & Suzuki came in the first race of the season at Suzuka. The leading car had hard tires while Olofsson/Suzkui had opted for soft tires at the start of the race. Once the temperature dropped - 10 laps into the race - the Skyline took the lead and was never challenged again. The only other win came in round 2 at Nishi Nippon and they went on to finish 2nd overall in Division 1.

Source: All-Japan Touring Car Championship - 1988
